jobs.job_html:
Seamlessassist

Global Recruiter

Indorė, Madhya Pradesh, India
Or refer someone
Job Openings Global Recruiter

About the job Global Recruiter

Seamless Assist is seeking a skilled and experienced Global Recruiter to manage end-to-end recruitment across international markets. If you're passionate about connecting global talent with growing businesses and have a proven track record in full-cycle recruiting, wed love to hear from you!


Job Title: Global Recruiter

Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-Time
Industry: Recruitment & Talent Solutions (serving clients in various sectors including fitness, wellness, e-commerce, and tech)


Job Description:

As a Global Recruiter, you will own the entire recruitment process from sourcing to onboarding. Youll work closely with internal teams and clients to identify hiring needs, attract top-tier talent, and ensure a smooth, efficient, and engaging hiring experience across different regions and time zones.


Responsibilities:

  • Manage full-cycle recruitment internationally (sourcing, screening, interviews, offers, and onboarding)
  • Collaborate with clients and hiring managers to define job requirements and candidate profiles
  • Source candidates through job boards, social media, ATS platforms, and proactive outreach
  • Conduct candidate assessments and initial interviews
  • Coordinate and schedule client interviews, gather feedback, and facilitate offer negotiations
  • Maintain and update recruitment tracking tools and databases
  • Ensure compliance with global hiring standards and labor regulations
  • Build a strong pipeline of qualified candidates for future needs


Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in full-cycle international recruitment
  • Solid understanding of sourcing strategies and candidate evaluation methods
  • Experience working with a wide range of industries and roles
  • Excellent communication skills and cultural sensitivity when recruiting across regions
  • Proficient with tools like LinkedIn Recruiter, Workable, JobStreet, Indeed, and ATS systems
  • Organized, proactive, and capable of managing multiple roles simultaneously
  • Experience working remotely and across time zones is a must

Or refer someone

jobs.job_html:
Seamlessassist

Web Developer

Indorė, Madhya Pradesh, India
Or refer someone
Job Openings Web Developer

About the job Web Developer

Job Overview:

We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Web Developer to join our team. You will be responsible for building, improving, and maintaining functional and visually appealing websites and web applications that align with our business goals.

The ideal candidate is proficient in both front-end and/or back-end development, stays up-to-date with the latest trends in web technologies, and can deliver clean, responsive, and user-friendly solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain websites, landing pages, and web applications

  • Convert design mockups (Figma, Adobe XD, etc.) into responsive code (HTML, CSS, JS)

  • Optimize websites for speed, SEO, and mobile responsiveness

  • Troubleshoot and debug website issues quickly and effectively

  • Collaborate with designers, marketers, and other developers to execute projects

  • Ensure cross-browser compatibility and accessibility standards

  • Manage hosting, domains, and deployment when needed

  • Monitor and improve site performance and uptime

  • Stay current with emerging web development trends and technologies

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a Web Developer (portfolio or previous work required)

  • Strong understanding of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and responsive design

  • Familiarity with front-end libraries or frameworks (e.g., React, Vue.js, Bootstrap)

  • Knowledge of back-end development (PHP, Node.js, Python) is a plus

  • Experience with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress, Webflow, Shopify)

  • Ability to work with REST APIs and third-party integrations

  • Basic knowledge of SEO principles and page speed optimization

  • Familiar with Git, version control, and task management tools (e.g., GitHub, Trello)

  • Strong attention to detail, organization, and communication skills

Preferred Skills (Bonus):

  • Experience with eCommerce platforms

  • UI/UX design understanding

  • Google Analytics or basic tracking implementation

  • Hosting management (cPanel, Netlify, Vercel, etc.)

Tools & Tech Stack You Might Use:

  • Languages: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python

  • Frameworks: React, Vue.js, Bootstrap, Tailwind

  • CMS: WordPress, Webflow, Shopify

  • Tools: Figma, Git, Trello, Google Analytics, Cloudflare

Sample Hiring Message (for platforms like Upwork or LinkedIn):

Were currently hiring a Web Developer to join our growing team. If youre passionate about clean code, responsive design, and building websites that convertlets talk! This is a remote position with flexible hours and lots of opportunity for growth.

Manufacturing Associate

Or refer someone
Job Openings Manufacturing Associate

About the job Manufacturing Associate

Job Title: Manufacturing Associate

Job Location: Sanand, Gujarat 382110, India

Job Location Type: On-site

Job Contract Type: Full-time

Job Seniority Level: Entry level

Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.

Micron Technology is a world leader in innovating memory and storage solutions that accelerate the transformation of information into intelligence, inspiring the world to learn, communicate and advance faster than ever.

Job Description : As Manufacturing specialist, your job responsibilities include completing assigned manufacturing tasks, following company policies and work procedures. you will be required to work under the supervision of manufacturing supervisors, with fellow production operators, production leadership, technicians, and engineers to complete manufacturing jobs in an efficient manner to meet the department targets and goals. Ability to read, write, and speak English is required.

Responsibilities And Tasks

Be involved in Processing Raw Materials into the final Product

  • Accept job assignments and adapt to change.
  • Identify any special customer requests for the assigned job.
  • Obtain required materials and tooling for assigned jobs.
  • Set up equipment whenever there is a product change to run on the equipment.
  • Prioritize and complete all tasks required to process product.
  • Manage time and efficiency to complete assigned job on time.
  • Identify, troubleshoot, and communicate any issues or problems encountered during setup or while processing product.

Follow Company and Department Policies and Procedures

  • Identify required company, department, safety, and job-related policies and procedures.
  • Read policies and procedures.
  • Apply policies and procedures to job assignments.
  • Provide or accept feedback as necessary to leads/trainers and supporting personnel (i.e. Planning or Engineering)

Complete Certification and Recertification

  • Participate in assigned on-the-job and other required training.
  • Ask questions and request or provide feedback through the training process to increase knowledge and ability.
  • Complete certification requirements by demonstrating understanding and abilities.
  • Track training in the designated training system.

Adhere to Company rules and regulations and Promote Safety in the Workplace.

  • Identify and promptly report hazards.
  • Follow safety procedures and area work rules including proper personal protective equipment and chemical safety.
  • Operate and maintain equipment and tools within manufacturers and company guidelines.

About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life for all. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron® and Crucial® brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities — from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.

To learn more, please visit micron.com/careers

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact

Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.

Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.

Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist

Or refer someone
Job Openings Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist

About the job Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist

Job Title: Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist

Job Location: Mexico City, CDMX, Mexico

Job Location Type: On-site

Job Contract Type: Permanent

Job Seniority Level:

Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist - Homebased - Mexico

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organization. We’re proud to foster an inclusive environment driving innovation and excellence, and we welcome you to join us on our mission to shape the future of clinical development.

We are currently seeking a Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist to join our diverse and dynamic team. As a Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Specialist at ICON, you will play a pivotal role in designing and analyzing clinical trials, interpreting complex medical data, and contributing to the advancement of inNvative treatments and therapies.

What you will be doing:

  • Developing global regulatory strategies for the successful submission and approval of clinical trial applications and marketing authorizations.
  • Providing regulatory guidance and support to cross-functional teams throughout the drug development process.
  • Ensuring compliance with global regulatory requirements and standards.
  • Managing regulatory submissions and interactions with health authorities.
  • Participating in regulatory intelligence activities to stay updated on changes in regulations and guidelines.

Your profile:

  • Bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline or related field.
  • 5 years of experience in regulatory affairs within the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry.
  • Strong understanding of global regulatory requirements and guidelines.
  • Excellent communication and social skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proficiency in English (this is a client facing global role).

#LI-FB2

#LI-Remote

What ICON can offer you:
Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.

Our benefits examples include:

  • Various annual leave entitlements
  • A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family’s needs.
  • Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximize savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
  • Global Employee Assistance Programme, LifeWorks, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialized professionals who are there to support you and your family’s well-being.
  • Life assurance
  • Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidized travel passes, health assessments, among others.

Visit our careers site to read more about the benefits ICON offers.

At ICON, inclusion & belonging are fundamental to our culture and values. We’re dedicated to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for all candidates. ICON is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know or submit a request here

Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless – there’s every chance you’re exactly what we’re looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

Clinical Trial Liaison

Or refer someone
Job Openings Clinical Trial Liaison

About the job Clinical Trial Liaison

Job Title: Clinical Trial Liaison

Job Location: Calgary, AB, Canada

Job Location Type: On-site

Job Contract Type: Permanent

Job Seniority Level: Mid-Senior level

The Clinical Trial Liaison (CTL) role is designed to transform the clinical research site experience by making the customer experience a priority. This strategic role serves as a critical interface between the organization and clinical research sites, focusing on therapeutic area networking, site outreach, education, specialized training, and enrollment acceleration. Reporting to the Director, GCO, Patient and Site Engagement, the CTL must have a strong understanding of clinical research and regional regulatory requirements, while also providing leadership and operational expertise across multiple therapeutic areas.


What you will be doing:

  • Serve as a professional, competent representative in direct interaction with clinical trial investigators, academic institutions, and therapeutic area networks related to studies in feasibility and site selection, and conduct routine visits during the life of a study
  • Identify new sites for consideration, conducting therapeutic area network and site outreach and influence culture about clinical research. Include focus on diverse investigators in underrepresented communities.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements to achieve better results in study execution and feedback information to the functions and study teams
  • Decision maker in country/site selection activities, representing regional insight and interests in collaboration with Medical Affairs, including new sites and new regions
  • Participation in Clinical Trial Allocation Committee meetings
  • Understand the scientific aspects of a protocol that will help with site engagement, indication investigation, determining the key eligibility criteria for trail subjects ensuring trial success at participating sites
  • Support site training through discussions of the investigational product and provide the rational for study design and key eligibility criteria in collaboration with Clinical Development
  • Conduct specialized trainings
  • Can provide additional support to prioritized programs as needed
  • Define, monitor and report Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for site performance
  • Stay abreast of regulations and industry trends and proactively prepare to maintain compliance
  • Leverage understanding of local regulations and trial implementation pathways to ensure streamlined site start-up
  • May take on a Disease Area Lead role to streamline communication between project teams and CTLs
  • Provide input into the development of feasibility questionnaires
  • Develop and manage relationships with external site and therapeutic area networks
  • Travel may be required up to 50% of time.

You are:

  • Bachelor's degree in relevant discipline
  • Typically requires 7 years of experience in Clinical Development or the equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience as a Clinical Trial Liaison or a similar role
  • Proven track record of managing long-term professional relationships (e.g. Clinical sites)
  • Must have good working knowledge of ICH, FDA, EU-CTR, IRB/IEC and other applicable regulations/guidelines and experience with Clinical Site start-up documents

 


What ICON can offer you:

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.

Our benefits examples include:

  • Various annual leave entitlements
  • A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family’s needs
  • Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximise savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead
  • Global Employee Assistance Programme, TELUS Health, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialised professionals who are there to support you and your family’s well-being
  • Life assurance
  • Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidised travel passes, health assessments, among others



Visit our careers website to read more about the benefits of working at ICON: https://careers.iconplc.com/benefits

At ICON, inclusion & belonging are fundamental to our culture and values. We’re dedicated to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for all candidates. ICON is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.

https://careers.iconplc.com/reasonable-accommodations

Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless – there’s every chance you’re exactly what we’re looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

Leverage understanding of local regulations and trial implementation pathways to ensure streamlined site start-up
May take on a Disease Area Lead role to streamline communication between project teams and CTLs
Provide input into the development of feasibility questionnaires
Develop and manage relationships with external site and therapeutic area networks
Travel may be required up to 50% of time.
You are:
Bachelor's degree in relevant discipline
Typically requires 7 years of experience in Clinical Development or the equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience as a Clinical Trial Liaison or a similar role
Proven track record of managing long-term professional relationships (e.g. Clinical sites)
Must have good working knowledge of ICH, FDA, EU-CTR, IRB/IEC and other applicable regulations/guidelines and experience with Clinical Site start-up documents

jobs.job_html:
Manufacturing Engineer

Ayer, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Manufacturing Engineer

About the job Manufacturing Engineer


Job Summary:

The Manufacturing Engineer will support new project development, provide sustaining engineering support for production programs, and drive improvements in manufacturing methods and procedures.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Lead and support continuous improvement initiatives within manufacturing operations, identifying opportunities for process optimization and cost reduction.
  • Enhance manufacturing methods and processes to improve product quality, reduce cycle times, and minimize waste.
  • Collect and analyze manufacturing data to evaluate production efficiency, identify areas for improvement, and provide data-driven recommendations to management.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in the production process, collaborating with production teams to implement corrective actions.
  • Provide technical training to production staff on new manufacturing processes, equipment, and best practices.
  • Develop and maintain documentation for equipment operation, preventive maintenance, and troubleshooting procedures.
  • Ensure proper execution of equipment tests and validation protocols (IQ, OQ, & PQ), documenting procedures, test results, and analyses.
  • Travel up to 50% to work with automation vendors for troubleshooting, equipment functionality assessment, and technical training. Upon equipment arrival, facilitate knowledge transfer and training for automation technicians and internal teams, ensuring proper maintenance and operational best practices.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Essential Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Industrial, Manufacturing, or a related field) preferred.
  • A minimum of 2 years of relevant technical experience in a manufacturing or engineering environment.
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with the ability to troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve machinery and process-related technical issues.
  • Solid understanding of manufacturing processes, with the ability to identify inefficiencies and implement improvements.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with experience applying engineering principles to enhance production efficiency, reduce downtime, and improve quality.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to train, mentor, and effectively transfer knowledge to internal teams.
  • Ability to travel for vendor support and training as needed. Est 25-50% sporadically.
  • Strong time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects effectively.
  • Self-starter with a proactive approach to identifying areas for improvement and driving projects to completion with minimal supervision.
  • Must be able to use Microsoft Excel and Word proficiently
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English

At SMC Ltd. we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. We know that our differences often can bring about innovation, excellence and meaningful worktherefore, people from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodations during the interview process.

SMC Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V; this organization uses E-Verify.

Applicants may be subject to pre-employment screening which may include drug screening, reference checks, employment verifications, background screening and/or skills assessments.

All applicants must be authorized to work in the US

Ayer, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Quality Inspector (Night Shift 8pm-8am)

About the job Quality Inspector (Night Shift 8pm-8am)


Quality Inspector I: D Shift (8PM-8AM)


About Us:

SMC, Ltd. is a globally recognized premium supplier to the medical market with locations throughout the world. People committed to speed, technology, and exceptional performance are the cornerstone of our organization. Comprised of dedicated people and decades of manufacturing experience, we have continued to experience strong growth and currently have outstanding career opportunities for equally dedicated people.

Job Summary:

Monitors the daily in-process production by performing visual, dimensional and functional inspections.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform visual, dimensional and functional inspections in accordance with In-Process inspection procedures and documents in Control plan as required
  • Dimensionally inspect product utilizing various measuring devices, such as calipers, micrometers, vision systems
  • Document inspection data on appropriate records.
  • Utilize computer to record statistical data
  • Able to use day to day gaging used in QA Lab
  • Able to recognize defects on the molded/assembled parts
  • Able to read and follow requirements on a control plan
  • Regular attendance, punctuality and professionalism

Essential Qualifications:

  • Follow procedures for retaining samples
  • Notify Supervisor/Lead of any non-conformances. Follow procedures for product rejections
  • Maintain cleanliness of work areas and Quality Control equipment
  • Generate Labels for daily production retains/tailgates at the start of each shift
  • Responsible for supervising the rework of nonconforming product in the hold area and performing final inspection on reworked product if instructed
  • Maintain quality areas clean, neat and organized
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English
  • Minimum 1-3 years prior experience in Quality Control
  • Recommended 1-year experience in Plastic Injection Molding Environment
  • Experience with precision measuring equipment
  • Blueprint Interpretation skills.
  • Must have computer skills and familiarity with Word and Excel programs
  • Knowledge of SPC and ISO 9001 & 13485 system requirements
  • Ability to pay close attention to detail
  • Ability to work well with others and independently.
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English

ADA Requirements:

  • Stand, walk, bend, squat, twist, reach or otherwise move frequently
  • Occasional repetitive motion and grasping
  • Occasional climbing to reach areas on machines or racks
  • Lift, move or otherwise transfer up to 50 lbs. occasionally, >20 lbs. frequently
  • Typically sits, grasps items or performs keyboarding for occasional operation of a computer
  • Exposure to typical machine shop physical hazards which may require respiratory protection

At SMC Ltd. we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. Ayer, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Automation Engineer

About the job Automation Engineer

Automation Engineer II

About Us:

SMC, Ltd. is a globally recognized premium supplier to the medical market with locations throughout the world. People committed to speed, technology, and exceptional performance are the cornerstone of our organization. Comprised of dedicated people and decades of manufacturing experience, we have continued to experience strong growth and currently have outstanding career opportunities for equally dedicated people.

Job Summary: Assist in the development and implementation of manufacturing and automation equipment / systems for new projects and equipment in operation while improving manufacturing methods / procedures in accordance with product specifications and quality standards.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Participate on and lead project teams as assigned in support of new projects to perform research, review, and develop manufacturing equipment and automation systems to maximize efficiencies, analyze layout of equipment, workflow, assembly methods and work force utilization.
  • Support the fabrication, assembly, testing, and development of secondary equipment and processes, automation and assembly equipment, EOATs, fixtures, etc. which may involve internal design, specification, quoting, sourcing and management of external automation suppliers.
  • Develop documentation related to equipment and systems for standard operation, preventive maintenance, and troubleshooting. Analyze and evaluate manufacturing methods / equipment to maintain state-of-the-art systems and provide solutions for problems that adversely affect cost, operator safety, productivity and quality.
  • Ensure execution of equipment tests and supporting validations per IQ, OQ, & PQ protocols, including the documented procedures used, test results and analysis.
  • Recommend and implement cost reductions in manufacturing to improve yield, reduce scrap, and increase efficiencies.
  • Abide by all applicable SMC procedures and guidelines.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Essential Qualifications:

  • A bachelors degree in engineering and 3 years of experience; OR a two-year post high school diploma / certificate in a related field and technical trade and 5 years of experience.
  • Proficient PC skills in a Windows environment.
  • SolidWorks experience and ability to work from 2D prints and CAD details and review 3D solid models.
  • Understanding in reading electrical and pneumatic schematics.
  • Knowledgeable of PLC programs.
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills.
  • Strong interpersonal, leadership and communication skills.
  • Strong Team Player.
  • Demonstrated effective interpersonal and communication skills.

Desirable Qualifications:

  • Robotic programming experience.
  • Experience with vision systems.
  • Experience with lean manufacturing concepts.

ADA Requirements:

  • Typically sits, grasps items and performs keyboarding for frequent operation of a computer
  • Stand, walk, bend, reach or otherwise move about regularly
  • Lift, move, or otherwise transfer items up to 40 lbs. occasionally, >20 lbs. frequently
  • Occasional exposure to typical machine shop physical hazards
  • Travel by air or car frequently

Manufacturing Associate

Ayer, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Manufacturing Associate

About the job Manufacturing Associate

Manufacturing Associate

 Shift openings 

Day shift 8:00am- 8:00pm 12hr rotating shifts 2 weekends a month & Night Shift 8pm-8am 12 hour rot


Position Scope and Purpose:

Operate equipment to meet daily production requirements while meeting all quality expectations and safety standards. Inspect production and package product. Follow daily schedules, SWIs, and SOPs to produce devices or components that comply with customer specifications.

Key Accountabilities/Essential Functions:

  • Complete Tasks within assigned work center in accordance with Product specific work instructions.
  • Required to read, comprehend controlled work instructions in order to identify manufacturing documentation and work instructions as required.
  • Responsible for visual inspection of product for defects as identified in the work instructions.
  • Segregate and document rejected or scrap product within assigned work center(s) utilizing SMCs Red Bin Procedure.
  • Maintain a safe and organized work space.
  • Maintain compliance with all required documentation utilizing proper GDP.
  • Must be able to learn and understand Lock Out Tag Out procedure as an affected employee.
  • Regular attendance and professionalism.

Other Position Duties:

  • Notify Cell Lead or Shift Supervisor when problems interrupt work flow and output.
  • Notify the Cell Lead or QC when a defect is found.
  • Verify that equipment is operating properly. Notify Cell Lead or Shift Supervisor when it is not.
  • Abide by all applicable clean room procedures and guidelines.
  • Adhere to all safety practices.
  • Follow standard work and cGMP guidelines.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Level I Associate:

  • High School diploma or equivalent required.
  • The ability to read, write, speak, and comprehend English.
  • Ability to work well with others in a team environment and independently is essential.
  • Self motivated.
  • Good written, verbal, and presentation skills.
  • Keen Attention to Detail
  • High Manual Dexterity Preferred

Level II Associate:

  • Same qualifications as above
  • Manufacturing Experience of Greater than 6 Months Required

Level III Associate:

  • Same qualifications as above
  • Manufacturing Experience of Greater than 6 Months Required
  • Manufacturing Experience in a Clean Room Environment Preferred

Ayer, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Quality Inspector (Night Shift 8pm-8am)

About the job Quality Inspector (Night Shift 8pm-8am)


Quality Inspector I: D Shift (8PM-8AM)


About Us:

SMC, Ltd. is a globally recognized premium supplier to the medical market with locations throughout the world. People committed to speed, technology, and exceptional performance are the cornerstone of our organization. Comprised of dedicated people and decades of manufacturing experience, we have continued to experience strong growth and currently have outstanding career opportunities for equally dedicated people.

Job Summary:

Monitors the daily in-process production by performing visual, dimensional and functional inspections.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform visual, dimensional and functional inspections in accordance with In-Process inspection procedures and documents in Control plan as required
  • Dimensionally inspect product utilizing various measuring devices, such as calipers, micrometers, vision systems
  • Document inspection data on appropriate records.
  • Utilize computer to record statistical data
  • Able to use day to day gaging used in QA Lab
  • Able to recognize defects on the molded/assembled parts
  • Able to read and follow requirements on a control plan
  • Regular attendance, punctuality and professionalism

Essential Qualifications:

  • Follow procedures for retaining samples
  • Notify Supervisor/Lead of any non-conformances. Follow procedures for product rejections
  • Maintain cleanliness of work areas and Quality Control equipment
  • Generate Labels for daily production retains/tailgates at the start of each shift
  • Responsible for supervising the rework of nonconforming product in the hold area and performing final inspection on reworked product if instructed
  • Maintain quality areas clean, neat and organized
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English
  • Minimum 1-3 years prior experience in Quality Control
  • Recommended 1-year experience in Plastic Injection Molding Environment
  • Experience with precision measuring equipment
  • Blueprint Interpretation skills.
  • Must have computer skills and familiarity with Word and Excel programs
  • Knowledge of SPC and ISO 9001 & 13485 system requirements
  • Ability to pay close attention to detail
  • Ability to work well with others and independently.
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English

ADA Requirements:

  • Stand, walk, bend, squat, twist, reach or otherwise move frequently
  • Occasional repetitive motion and grasping
  • Occasional climbing to reach areas on machines or racks
  • Lift, move or otherwise transfer up to 50 lbs. occasionally, >20 lbs. frequently
  • Typically sits, grasps items or performs keyboarding for occasional operation of a computer
  • Exposure to typical machine shop physical hazards which may require respiratory protection

Automation Engineer

Ayer, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Automation Engineer

About the job Automation Engineer

Automation Engineer II

About Us:

SMC, Ltd. is a globally recognized premium supplier to the medical market with locations throughout the world. People committed to speed, technology, and exceptional performance are the cornerstone of our organization. Comprised of dedicated people and decades of manufacturing experience, we have continued to experience strong growth and currently have outstanding career opportunities for equally dedicated people.

Job Summary: Assist in the development and implementation of manufacturing and automation equipment / systems for new projects and equipment in operation while improving manufacturing methods / procedures in accordance with product specifications and quality standards.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Participate on and lead project teams as assigned in support of new projects to perform research, review, and develop manufacturing equipment and automation systems to maximize efficiencies, analyze layout of equipment, workflow, assembly methods and work force utilization.
  • Support the fabrication, assembly, testing, and development of secondary equipment and processes, automation and assembly equipment, EOATs, fixtures, etc. which may involve internal design, specification, quoting, sourcing and management of external automation suppliers.
  • Develop documentation related to equipment and systems for standard operation, preventive maintenance, and troubleshooting. Analyze and evaluate manufacturing methods / equipment to maintain state-of-the-art systems and provide solutions for problems that adversely affect cost, operator safety, productivity and quality.
  • Ensure execution of equipment tests and supporting validations per IQ, OQ, & PQ protocols, including the documented procedures used, test results and analysis.
  • Recommend and implement cost reductions in manufacturing to improve yield, reduce scrap, and increase efficiencies.
  • Abide by all applicable SMC procedures and guidelines.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Essential Qualifications:

  • A bachelors degree in engineering and 3 years of experience; OR a two-year post high school diploma / certificate in a related field and technical trade and 5 years of experience.
  • Proficient PC skills in a Windows environment.
  • SolidWorks experience and ability to work from 2D prints and CAD details and review 3D solid models.
  • Understanding in reading electrical and pneumatic schematics.
  • Knowledgeable of PLC programs.
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills.
  • Strong interpersonal, leadership and communication skills.
  • Strong Team Player.
  • Demonstrated effective interpersonal and communication skills.

Desirable Qualifications:

  • Robotic programming experience.
  • Experience with vision systems.
  • Experience with lean manufacturing concepts.

ADA Requirements:

  • Typically sits, grasps items and performs keyboarding for frequent operation of a computer
  • Stand, walk, bend, reach or otherwise move about regularly
  • Lift, move, or otherwise transfer items up to 40 lbs. occasionally, >20 lbs. frequently
  • Occasional exposure to typical machine shop physical hazards
  • Travel by air or car frequently

At SMC Ltd. we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. Project Manager - Clean Energy & Regulatory Implementation

Irwindale, California, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Project Manager - Clean Energy & Regulatory Implementation

About the job Project Manager - Clean Energy & Regulatory Implementation

Position: Project Manager Clean Energy & Regulatory Implementation

Become a Project Manager Clean Energy & Regulatory Implementation and build a better tomorrow. In this job, youll lead high-impact, cross-functional initiatives that support the implementation of CPUC-mandated requirements and clean energy policies. As a Project Manager, youll play a key role in shaping regulatory outcomes, driving continuous improvement, and supporting Californias clean energy transition. This is a dynamic position ideal for someone passionate about energy policy, stakeholder collaboration, and delivering results in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the activities of one or more moderate to large, short to mid-term projects with responsibility for results in terms of costs, methods, and outcomes

  • Exercise considerable latitude and judgment in developing plans, budgets, and resources, directing activities and actions, and determining deliverables

  • Decide appropriate methods and procedures for new projects with significant independence

  • Engage with all levels of management and act as a key consultant for both functional and business issues

  • Facilitate project execution, administration, correspondence, and flow of information/data

  • Analyze and determine regulatory impacts and requirements of the project

  • Identify deviations in the project plan, identify issues and lead efforts to resolve them without compromising the original project goals, budget, and timing

  • Forecast project resources, materials, and contract costs within standard tools

  • Analyze policies and procedures and provide next-step recommendations as needed

  • Assess project risks and develop contingency plans

  • Identify and communicate lessons learned and best practices

  • Follow effective project governance and reporting in-line with project management standards

  • Maintain progress reports, conduct change impact assessments, and use project management tools

  • Maintain a system to measure the effectiveness of the project development process

  • Ensure the protection of physical, financial, and cybersecurity assets and manage sensitive data with high integrity

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Seven or more years of experience in project management

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Understanding of California energy policy, CPUC regulatory processes, and clean energy programs

  • Experience managing cross-functional projects involving regulatory compliance, rate design, or demand response

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex regulatory or technical topics for diverse audiences

  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects

  • Experience developing and implementing process improvements or continuous improvement initiatives

  • Familiarity with stakeholder engagement, legislative review processes, and customer advocacy in a regulated environment

Vets Hired

Purchasing Specialist

Rosemead, California, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Purchasing Specialist

About the job Purchasing Specialist


Position: Purchasing Specialist

Become a Purchasing Specialist and build a better tomorrow. In this job, youll be supporting sourcing strategies for the energy infrastructure of tomorrow in areas such as transportation electrification, energy efficiency, renewable energy, energy storage, customer experience, and Information Technology within the Indirect Procurement (IP) team. The Indirect Procurement group manages over $1.2 billion in annual spend for Information Technology, Customer Service, Professional Services, and Consulting Services.

Its challenging but deeply rewarding work. Your interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills will be fully exercised as you manage a variety of strategies that focus on value creation, cost savings, continuous improvement, and risk mitigation. You will be responsible for supporting the development and optimization of sourcing strategies and continuous improvement initiatives. You will lead/participate in competitive solicitations, supplier selection, achievement of applicable Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), contract negotiations, and development.

Responsibilities

  • Assists in driving innovation, improving ways of working, and enhancing supplier management systems

  • Aids in executing purchasing and sourcing strategies, addressing short-term and long-term material requirements to achieve the purchasing performance metrics of timely delivery, right quality, and optimum cost

  • Assists with the undertaking of analysis supporting the resolution of risk issues and gap identification

  • Participates in the negotiation process to achieve best value and commercial terms and conditions of moderately complex purchase orders, change orders, requests for proposals, and contracts/agreements

  • Aids in training peers and other stakeholders on the procurement process

  • Helps maintain effective stakeholder relationships with internal customers to become a trusted business partner

  • Aids in identifying critical suppliers and creates appropriate engagement plans to ensure the supply chain risk profile and inputs to continuous improvement are proactively managed

  • Helps understand suppliers position, desired outcomes, and leverage points and establishes structured negotiation plans with clarity of desired outcomes, leveraging stakeholder input and support where appropriate

Note: A material job duty of all positions is ensuring the protection of all physical, financial, and cybersecurity assets, and properly accessing and managing private customer data, proprietary information, confidential medical records, and other types of highly sensitive information and data with the highest standards of conduct and integrity.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Three or more years of experience in supply chain, procurement, and/or contract management

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience using SAP software in a purchasing environment, and utilizing Ariba Sourcing, Contracting, and P2P modules

  • Experience sourcing new vendors

  • Experience leading a Request for Proposal (RFP), Request for Quotation (RFQ), or Request for Information (RFI) process

  • Knowledge and decision-making experience of purchasing practices and policies, and knowledge of procurement contracts and standard terms and conditions

  • Experience with industry best practices, standards, utility regulations, procedures and compliance as they relate to purchasing

  • Experience prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously, and analyzing information and making strategic decisions regarding scope, impact, policy, development, and implementation

  • CPM, CPSM, CPCM, CCCM, and/or PMP certification(s)

Office Admin

 Job Description:

Job Summary:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Office Administrator to manage daily operations and support various administrative functions. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with strong organizational skills, advanced computer proficiency, and experience with AI tools and social media platforms. This role involves digitizing paperwork, managing spreadsheets, and supporting internal communications and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and organize digital and physical office records

  • Digitize paperwork and update spreadsheets with accuracy and timeliness

  • Manage and schedule social media content across platforms

  • Utilize AI tools to streamline repetitive administrative tasks

  • Provide general administrative support, including calendar management, data entry, and document preparation

  • Support interdepartmental communication and project coordination

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as an Office Administrator, Administrative Assistant, or similar role

  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook) and Google Workspace

  • Familiarity with AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, automation software)

  • Experience managing business social media accounts (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)

  • Excellent time management and organizational skills

  • Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks efficiently

  • High attention to detail and strong written/verbal communication skills

Psychologist (Licensed)

California City, California, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Psychologist (Licensed)

About the job Psychologist (Licensed)

Our client is currently seeking Licensed Psychologists who have a passion for providing the highest quality care in an institutional setting.

Responsibilities

  • The successful candidate should be able to perform ALL of the following functions at a pace and level of performance consistent with the actual job performance requirements.
  • Conducts psychological screenings and assessments based on review of available records, and clinical interviews with inmates.
  • As part of a mental health team, confers with other clinical staff, e.g., psychiatrists, mental health service providers, physicians, nurses, social workers, in order to gather and provide information concerning patient psychological problems, to ensure treatment activities are well integrated, and patient care follow-through occurs.
  • Provides treatment to inmates by developing, implementing, and modifying individual treatment plans based on evaluation of needs and level of functioning.
  • Makes regular rounds in segregation or other confined housing areas to assess inmate adjustment and mental health treatment needs.
  • Demonstrates a thorough knowledge of psychological counseling theory and techniques by way of treatments and activities used for individuals in caseload.
  • Provides appropriate mental health assessments, counseling, and confrontation avoidance interventions to address the needs of inmates in crisis.
  • Consults with psychiatry, mental health, nursing, medical, educational, chaplain, security staff, and others, as applicable to gather information and understanding into the reasons for the escalation of problems behaviors and changes in mental health condition of inmates.

  • Must-Haves

    Graduate from an accredited college or university with a Doctoral degree in Psychology.

    Must possess a current, unrestricted license to practice psychology in the state where practice occurs
  • Must have two years clinical experience, which includes one year in a comparable position

Benefits

  • Dental, Medical, Vision, Life Insurance
  • Retirement
  • Equity
  • Work from Home
  • Paid Time Off

Deerfield Beach, Florida, United States

Job Openings Production Assembler

About the job Production Assembler

Seeking an experienced Production Assembler.

 Execute hands-on lab racking and stacking procedures, including the assembly and setup of intricate rack configurations. Ensure meticulous installation and integration of all components and associated cabling. 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Rack & Install Hardware: Mount, install, and secure servers, switches, routers, radios, and other rack mount components in 19 EIA racks.
  • Power Distribution: Install and connect power distribution units (PDUs), circuit breakers, and UPS systems.
  • Structured Cabling: Route, terminate, and test Cat5e, Cat6, Cat6a cables following TIA/EIA standards.
  • Fiber Optic Installation: Install, splice, terminate, and test fiber optic cables (single-mode & multi-mode) using OTDR and light meters.
  • Cable Management: Organize and label data, ethernet, fiber optic, COAX, RF and power cables for a clean and efficient layout.
  • Hardware Configuration: Connect and verify data, RF and power connections; perform initial device light-off and configuration.
  • Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve hardware, cabling, and connectivity issues.
  • Candidate must be able to lift up to 50 pounds.
  • Follow technical instructions, interpret engineering blueprints and technical terms.
  • Inventory parts and tools used in the assembling process.
  • Follow company procedures and directives.
  • Test finished products for defects.
  • Maintain the tools used to create products.
  • Keep a clean and well-maintained workspace.
  • Meet quality, productivity, turnaround time and other expectations
  • Expertly route cables and fibers in organized, professional manner to maximize future maintenance and serviceability.

Execute hands-on lab racking and stacking procedures, including the assembly and setup of intricate rack configurations. Ensure meticulous installation and integration of all components and associated cabling.
Job Responsibilities:
Rack & Install Hardware: Mount, install, and secure servers, switches, routers, radios, and other rack mount components in 19 EIA racks.
Power Distribution: Install and connect power distribution units (PDUs), circuit breakers, and UPS systems.
Structured Cabling: Route, terminate, and test Cat5e, Cat6, Cat6a cables following TIA/EIA standards.
Fiber Optic Installation: Install, splice, terminate, and test fiber optic cables (single-mode & multi-mode) using OTDR and light meters.
Cable Management: Organize and label data, ethernet, fiber optic, COAX, RF and power cables for a clean and efficient layout.
Hardware Configuration: Connect and verify data, RF and power connections; perform initial device light-off and configuration.
Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve hardware, cabling, and connectivity issues.
Candidate must be able to lift up to 50 pounds.
Follow technical instructions, interpret engineering blueprints and technical terms.
Inventory parts and tools used in the assembling process.
Follow company procedures and directives.
Test finished products for defects.
Maintain the tools used to create products.
Keep a clean and well-maintained workspace.
Meet quality, productivity, turnaround time and other expectations
Expertly route cables and fibers in organized, professional manner to maximize future maintenance and serviceability.

Heart Failure ICU Nurse Practitioner (Night Shift)

Houston, Texas, United States

$ 135,200.00 - 147,680.00 (US Dollar)

Job Openings Heart Failure ICU Nurse Practitioner (Night Shift)

About the job Heart Failure ICU Nurse Practitioner (Night Shift)

Heart Failure ICU Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP) Nights | High-Acuity Cardiac Care

Location: Houston, TX (Texas Medical Center)
Schedule: Full-Time | Nights | 7:00 PM/7:00 AM | 3x12s | Rotating weekends/holidays
Salary Range: $135,200 - $147,680 (Plus 8% Medical Center Differential)
Relocation Assistance: Partial ($1,000 - $5,000, based on mileage)
Sign-On Bonus: Not offered
Call Requirement: None
Credentialing Timeline: 2-3 months

The Opportunity

If you are an Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP) with deep roots in cardiology and critical care, this position offers a rare chance to join one of the nations most advanced heart failure ICU teams. Our client, a nationally ranked, academic-affiliated facility, is recognized for groundbreaking work in mechanical circulatory support, transplant recovery, and ECMO.

This role is ideal for experienced acute care NPs or new NPs with prior cardiac ICU RN experience looking to elevate their career into the highest levels of clinical practice.

What You'll Be Doing

You will function as an autonomous APP within a multidisciplinary ICU team that manages:

  • Advanced heart failure, cardiogenic shock, and post-op cardiac surgery

  • LVAD, VV/VA ECMO, mechanical circulatory support (MCS), and transplant patients

  • Daily rounds, care planning, procedures (where credentialed), and family communication

  • Interpretation of diagnostics, ordering appropriate tests and therapies

  • Close collaboration with cardiologists, intensivists, surgeons, perfusionists, and nurses

This is not a general ICU role it requires a strong foundation in high-acuity cardiac and transplant care.

Required Qualifications (Must-Haves)

AGACNP certification required Family Nurse Practitioners (FNPs) will not be considered
Current Texas RN and APRN licensure (or eligible)
Board Certification: ANCC, AANP, or AACN in Acute Care
BLS & ACLS Must be active and valid
Minimum 2 years clinical experience as either an RN or NP in:

  • Heart failure, cardiac critical care, CV recovery, cardiology, or transplant

New grad NPs must have 2-3 years prior RN experience in an ICU setting, specifically:

  • CVICU, CTICU, heart transplant, LVAD/ECMO unit, or cardiac step-down

Nice-To-Have Experience

Direct experience with:

  • Heart failure patient population

  • Cardiovascular surgery recovery

  • Mechanical circulatory support, ECMO, LVAD, transplant ICU care
    Previous Acute Care NP experience in ICU, step-down, or intermediate cardiac units

Why This Role Stands Out

  • Join an elite ICU team operating at the forefront of cardiovascular innovation

  • Work with cutting-edge devices and critically ill populations rarely seen outside of top-tier academic medical centers

  • Enjoy predictable night shift scheduling with no call, and compensation that reflects your expertise

  • Earn an additional 8% geographical pay differential just for working at this high-acuity location

Ready to Apply?

This is a career-defining role for AGACNPs who are clinically sharp, emotionally resilient, and passionate about managing the sickest cardiac patients with confidence and care.

Do not apply unless you meet all minimum requirements.

https://www.careers-page.com/hirenow-staffing-inc/job/L7R373X5

Emergency Room RN - Night Shift (FT)

Mayfield, Kentucky, United States

$ 60,195.00 - 81,244.00 (US Dollar)

Job Openings Emergency Room RN - Night Shift (FT)

About the job Emergency Room RN - Night Shift (FT)

Emergency Room RN Night Shift (FT)

Location: Mayfield, KY
Schedule: Full-Time | Nights | 12-Hour Shifts | Rotating Weekends
Salary: $60,195 - $81,244 (Based on Experience)
Sign-On Bonus: $17,000 (Paid over the 1st year after 90 days with 2-year agreement)
Relocation Assistance: Partial

The Opportunity

HireNow Staffing is seeking an experienced Emergency Room Registered Nurse to join a high-performing hospital team in Mayfield, Kentucky. This isn't your average ER role we're looking for a nurse who can stay focused, make sharp decisions under pressure, and provide high-quality care during some of life's most critical moments. If you're passionate about delivering fast, compassionate, and competent emergency care we want to meet you.

Who This Role Is For

You're not new to the chaos of an ER you've got the confidence, skills, and steady hand it takes to manage everything from multi-trauma cases to pediatric fevers. You operate well on a night shift, prefer hands-on autonomy, and understand that patients and families depend on your calm, decisive care.

Must-Have Qualifications

To be considered for this role, all the following are required:

️ Valid RN license in Kentucky (or multistate compact license)
️ Minimum of 1 year of Emergency Room nursing experience
️ Basic Life Support (BLS) within 30 days of hire
️ Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) within 6 months of hire
️ Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) within 30 days of hire

Preferred But Not Required

⭐ Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN)
⭐ Handle with Care (HWC) certification within 6 months of hire
⭐ Solid understanding of trauma triage, ESI, and pediatric resuscitation
⭐ Experience in rural or high-volume emergency departments

Your Day-to-Day Responsibilities

In this fast-paced, team-oriented ER, you'll be expected to:

  • Assess, triage, and prioritize incoming patients using critical thinking and clinical judgment

  • Carry out all components of the nursing process, including med administration, documentation, and re-evaluations

  • Monitor patient conditions, vital signs, and mental status communicate changes immediately

  • Provide age-appropriate care across the lifespan, from infants to seniors

  • Coordinate with physicians, lab, radiology, and transport for efficient patient throughput

  • Respond to code situations and medical emergencies with poise and competence

  • Educate patients and families on condition management and follow-up care

  • Maintain clean, safe, and compliant work areas, following all infection control and safety protocols

  • Document all assessments and interventions thoroughly and accurately in the EMR

Skills Needed to Succeed Here

Calm under pressure and excellent decision-making in high-stakes situations
Familiar with ER meds, crash cart procedures, and trauma documentation
Compassionate communicator who builds trust with patients and families
Team player who's willing to jump in wherever needed during emergencies
Strong grasp of HIPAA, Joint Commission, and nursing scope-of-practice standards

Why You'll Want to Work Here

️ $17K Sign-On Bonus starts paying after your 90-day mark
️ Partial relocation reimbursement available
️ Work with a respected Kentucky healthcare system with a strong community reputation
️ Opportunity to sharpen your ER expertise in a busy, hands-on environment
️ Be part of a mission-driven team that puts patient safety and dignity first

Who Should Not Apply

New grads or nurses without ER-specific experience
RNs unwilling to work full-time night shifts or rotating weekends
Nurses not currently licensed in Kentucky or a compact state
Candidates uncomfortable working independently under pressure

Apply Today

This is a great opportunity to advance your ER nursing career with a stable hospital and supportive team that values excellence and urgency. If you're confident, calm in crisis, and ready to make a real difference every night apply now through HireNow Staffing.

﻿https://www.careers-page.com/hirenow-staffing-inc/job/L3XV7V78

Nurse Manager ICU

Sanford, North Carolina, United States

$ 76,000.00 - 90,000.00 (US Dollar)

Job Openings Nurse Manager ICU

About the job Nurse Manager ICU

Nurse Manager ICU / Med-Surg / Telemetry Units

Location: Sanford, North Carolina
Schedule: Full-Time | Onsite Leadership Role | Variable Shifts
Salary Range: $76,000 - $90,000 (commensurate with experience)
Sign-On Bonus: Up to $10,000 Commitment Incentive
Relocation: Not included

About the Opportunity

HireNow Staffing is partnering with a community-based hospital in central North Carolina to hire a Nurse Manager to oversee a combination of ICU, Medical-Surgical, and Telemetry units. This is a hands-on, operations-focused leadership role requiring a clinically competent RN leader ready to improve patient care delivery, manage interdisciplinary teams, and drive unit-level performance metrics.

This is not a remote or hybrid role you must be willing and able to lead on the floor and round regularly.

Who We Want (Must-Haves)

Licensed RN in the state of North Carolina (or compact multistate license)
Associate degree in nursing (ADN) required at minimum
Current BLS certification from American Heart Association (must be active within 30 days of hire)
Proven leadership experience in acute care charge nurse, assistant nurse manager, or higher
Familiarity with ICU-level acuity, med-surg workflow, and telemetry monitoring
Demonstrated ability to manage staffing, scheduling, and staff development in a clinical setting

Highly Preferred (Nice-to-Haves)

  • BSN degree or higher

  • Previous Nurse Manager experience in a multi-unit capacity

  • Strong grounding in bedside nursing care and evidence-based practice

  • Proficiency in clinical documentation systems (e.g., Meditech, Epic)

  • Solid track record of collaborating with interdisciplinary teams (pharmacy, PT/OT, case management)

Key Responsibilities

As the Nurse Manager, you will:

  • Oversee daily operations for ICU, med-surg, and telemetry ensuring staffing, safety, and clinical quality standards

  • Support a team of RNs, LPNs, CNAs, and support staff through mentoring, scheduling, and performance evaluation

  • Collaborate with the Director of Nursing and CNO to execute departmental goals and system-wide initiatives

  • Champion clinical education and ensure annual competencies are completed on time

  • Monitor and manage unit-based KPIs, including HCAHPS, readmission rates, infection control, and staff retention

  • Facilitate team huddles, debriefs, and incident response when necessary

  • Promote a culture of accountability, transparency, and respect upholding the organizations values

  • Assist with budget planning and cost control measures, including PPE, staffing ratios, and overtime management

Why This Role is Different

This is a career-growth opportunity for RNs with leadership ambitions or early manager experience looking to step into multi-unit responsibility. You'll have direct support from senior leadership, clinical educators, and a hospital that values autonomy, patient safety, and strong local impact.

If You're Ready

If you're currently managing or leading clinical teams and are seeking a role where you can directly influence patient care outcomes and staff development, we invite you to apply.

Please do not apply if you do not meet the minimum license, experience, or education criteria. This is not a training opportunity or interim role.

jobs.job_html:
Product Manager - K&L

Los Angeles, California, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Product Manager - K&L

About the job Product Manager - K&L

Product Manager (Remote, California-based)

Location: Remote (California-based required; ideally Bay Area or LA)occasional travel to SF/LA/Redwood City offices

Salary: $165 $210K

About the Role

Our client is on a mission to deliver the best wine & spirits shopping experience. Were looking for a scrappy, data-driven, low-ego Product Manager who lives and breathes customer experience. Youll play a pivotal role in transforming our eCommerce platform, working on initiatives that directly impact conversion, retention, and delight. If youre ready to wear multiple hats, thrive in ambiguity, and love seeing your work ship fastlets talk!

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive high-impact initiatives:
    • Lead projects such as a checkout redesign, Apple Pay integration, and a major site search & navigation revamp.
  • Obsess over customer experience:
    • Deeply understand users pain points and advocate for elegant, pragmatic solutions.
  • Become a system expert:
    • Over time, gain a deep, working knowledge of every part of our platform customer- and staff-facing aliketo anticipate edge cases and improve planning.
  • Facilitate and clarify:
    • Gather, organize, and distill information from across the company for complex projects. Partner with engineers and stakeholders to strike the right balance between usability, implementation speed, and technical constraints always aiming for the best outcome, not perfect theoretical solutions.
  • Triage and prioritize:
    • Proactively field, triage, and prioritize questions, bugs, enhancement requests, and feature ideas from both staff and customers. Make sure the most critical issues and the biggest opportunities always rise to the top.
  • Analyze, test, and ship:
    • Use SQL for data validation and analytics. Own documentation, testing, and helping ensure that what we build is both correct and valuable.
  • Stakeholder wrangling:
    • Communicate roadmaps and updates with clarity. Balance priorities between engineering, business, and customer support.
  • Multi-project juggling:
    • Comfortably shift gears between multiple initiatives never dropping a ball.

What You Wont Do

  • Youre not a scrum master. Our engineers run their own Jira boards and manage their own work.
  • While youll probably spend more time in Jira than the engineering team, project management and internal ticket tracking are not the key focus of this role.

Must-Have Skills & Experience

  • Proven PM chops (4+ years in product or a similar role)
  • Customer-obsessed and relentlessly resourceful
  • Data-driven decision-maker who is confident in SQL and Google Analytics (or a similar analytics tool) for validation and analysis
  • Clear, concise communicator (verbal & written)
  • Strong organizational skill-sable to manage several projects at once
  • Experience with stakeholder management in a fast-paced environment
  • Comfortable with iterative, experimentation-driven product development
  • Based in California (remote-first), with ability for occasional travel to SF/LA/Redwood City

Nice-to-Haves

  • Hands-on eCommerce or retail experience
  • Familiarity with Google Analytics and Jira
  • UI/UX design experience (an interest at minimum) able to contribute to usability discussions and make design recommendations
  • Exposure to Stripe or similar payment integrations

What You'll Love

  • High-impact role with real ownership
  • Fast-moving, collaborative, and low-drama team
  • Chance to shape how customers shop for wine & spirits online

Or refer someone

• Jobs

Nairobi, Kenya

Sales Agent Workforce & Support Services

 Job Description:

Job Type: Full-time (Remote / On-site / Hybrid based on business need)

Compensation: Retainer + Commission + Competitive Performance Bonuses

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Sales Agent to join our team, focused on delivering integrated workforce solutions. This role involves actively engaging with potential clients to present and sell our comprehensive services, including recruitment, payroll management, outsourcing, and cleaning services. You will be responsible for generating new business, managing client relationships, and contributing directly to the company's revenue growth.

Key Responsibilities:

Client Acquisition & Sales Execution

  • Identify and prospect new business opportunities within target markets for recruitment, payroll, outsourcing, and cleaning services.
  • Conduct thorough needs assessments with potential clients to understand their challenges and present tailored solutions.
  • Deliver compelling presentations and proposals that highlight the value of our integrated service offerings.
  • Negotiate and close B2B deals, achieving individual sales quotas and contributing to team targets.
  • Actively follow up on leads and manage a robust sales pipeline.

Relationship Management

  • Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with new and existing clients.
  • Identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling additional services to current clients.
  • Ensure high levels of client satisfaction throughout the sales process and beyond.

Services You Will Sell

  • Recruitment Services: Permanent, contract, and temporary staffing and Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO).
  • Payroll Management: End-to-end payroll processing, statutory compliance, and benefits administration.
  • Outsourcing Services: HR outsourcing, workforce deployment, and business process outsourcing (BPO).
  • Cleaning Services: Facility management support including janitorial, housekeeping, and commercial cleaning.

Sales Operations & Reporting

  • Utilize CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Zoho) to manage leads, track sales activities, and maintain accurate client information.
  • Provide regular updates on sales performance, pipeline status, and market feedback to the Sales Team Lead.
  • Collaborate with the operations and service delivery teams to ensure a smooth client onboarding experience.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Minimum 1-3 years of experience in B2B sales, preferably in HR, outsourcing, staffing, or facilities management services.
  • Proven track record of achieving sales targets in a commission-driven environment.
  • Basic understanding of recruitment workflows, payroll systems, outsourcing models, or soft services (e.g., cleaning).
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
  • Proficiency in using CRM platforms and basic sales tools.
  • Highly organized, self-motivated, and goal-oriented.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience selling integrated service portfolios.
  • Familiarity with labor laws or operational compliance.
  • Bachelors degree in Business or a related field.

Performance Metrics:

  • Individual revenue and quota attainment
  • New client acquisition
  • Pipeline growth and lead conversion rates
  • Client satisfaction scores
  Required Skills:

Sales Operations Payroll Processing Outsourcing Operations Sales Performance Compliance BASIC Recruitment Performance Metrics CRM New Business Opportunities Housekeeping Business Process Service Delivery Deals Onboarding Compensation Metrics Payroll Presentations Negotiation Administration Business Sales Communication Management

 Salary Package:

Ksh 20,000.00 - 25,000.00 (Kenyan Shilling)

 Package Details:

jobs.job_html:
Email & CRM Marketing Specialist

Cebu City, Cebu, Philippines
Job Openings Email & CRM Marketing Specialist

About the job Email & CRM Marketing Specialist

We're Hiring: Email & CRM Marketing Specialist
Design the Journeys That Turn Guests Into Direct Bookers and Keep Them Coming Back

Position: Email & CRM Marketing Specialist
Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)
Job Type: Full-Time
Experience Level: Mid-Level

About Us

We are a global digital education and support platform helping independent hotels increase direct bookings through a unique mix of training, coaching, WordPress hosting, and digital tools. Our mission is to help hotels succeed without depending on OTAsand email marketing is a key part of that journey.

We run live webinars, online courses, and hands-on support to help our clients grow - and now we're looking for an Email & CRM Marketing Specialist to own both internal and client-facing email strategy.

The Role

As our Email & CRM Specialist, you'll be responsible for creating and managing email campaigns, automations, onboarding flows, and platform notifications - both for our business and for our hotel clients. You'll also teach live webinars and coaching sessions that help hoteliers build effective email and CRM strategies on their own.

You'll combine hands-on execution with educational leadership, helping our clients and our team deliver the right message to the right guestat the right time.

Key Responsibilities

  • Plan, write, and build email campaigns (newsletters, offers, follow-ups)
  • Design onboarding sequences and automation flows for hotel clients and users
  • Host live webinars on email marketing strategies, guest engagement, and tools
  • Set up and manage transactional and platform-triggered emails (e.g., reminders, updates, receipts)
  • Help hotel clients integrate email tools (Mailchimp, MailerLite, etc.) with their websites
  • Create reusable templates, best practices, and email checklists
  • Support audience segmentation and personalized email content
  • Monitor deliverability, open rates, CTR, and overall campaign performance

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience with email marketing platforms (Mailchimp, MailerLite, ActiveCampaign, etc.)
  • Strong copywriting skills with attention to clarity, tone, and conversion
  • Experience designing and automating email flows and lifecycle campaigns
  • Comfortable hosting educational sessions and webinars
  • Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken)
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to data, metrics, and user journeys
  • Familiarity with GDPR, unsubscribe handling, and best practices

Preferred (but not required)

  • Background in hospitality, tourism, or e-commerce
  • Experience with WordPress, CRM integrations, or basic HTML email editing
  • Understanding of guest engagement, loyalty strategies, or upsell flows
  • Experience writing system messages or in-app notifications

What We Offer

  • Remote-first, flexible role with a supportive team
  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • A meaningful opportunity to impact hospitality businesses worldwide
  • Autonomy to shape how we (and our clients) do email
  • Opportunities to lead webinars and influence our training content
  • A mission-driven company committed to long-term relationships

How to Apply

Send your CV, a brief cover letter, and samples of email campaigns or automations youve built

If youve taught or hosted webinars about email marketing, include samples or links.

Be the expert that helps hotels turn inboxes into booking engines - and every guest touchpoint into a brand moment.
